title: Manchester City 'planning for Leroy Sane's exit as they eye Mikel Oyarzabal'
text:
Manchester City are eyeing Mikel Oyarzabal as a replacement for Leroy Sane according to Sky Germany.

The 22-year-old Oyarzabal has scored 28 goals over the past two seasons and impressed for champions Spain in this summer's Under-21 European Championship.

Sane was close to a move to Bayern Munich in the summer and City are already prepared to reinvest in a replacement.

Manchester City are eyeing Mikel Oyarzabal as a replacement for Leroy Sane (pictured)

Oyarzabal, who came through the Sociedad academy, has impressed with his consistent level of performances in the past two seasons.

His form was enough to earn a first cap for the Spanish national side in the 3-0 victory over Sweden in Euro 2020 qualifying in June, a match in which he scored.

The Basque club are keen to retain the striker's services but would be powerless if City chose to meet the £67million release clause in his contract.

Oyarzabal is contracted to Sociedad until 2024 and it would be the player's decision whether or not to join the Premier League champions.

Sane suffered an anterior cruciate ligament injury in City's Community Shield penalty-shootout victory over Liverpool in August and is not expected to be back until the New Year.
description: Manchester City are eyeing Mikel Oyarzabal as a replacement for Leroy Sane according to Sky Germany. The 22-year-old Oyarzabal has scored 28 goals over the past two seasons.
